Extractors#

The papercut.extractors module provides interfaces and implementations for extracting content from PDF files.

Extractor Protocol#

class papercut.extractors.base.Extractor[source]#

Protocol defining the interface for PDF extraction backends.

All extractor implementations must conform to this protocol.

Methods:

extract_text(path: Path, pages: list[int] | None = None) → str[source]#

Extract text content from a PDF file.

Parameters:

  • path – Path to the PDF file

  • pages – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers to extract. If None, extracts all pages.

Returns:

Extracted text as a string

Example:

from pathlib import Path

extractor = PdfPlumberExtractor()
text = extractor.extract_text(Path("paper.pdf"))
print(text[:500])

# Extract specific pages (0-indexed)
text = extractor.extract_text(Path("paper.pdf"), pages=[0, 1, 2])
extract_tables(path: Path, pages: list[int] | None = None) → list[dict][source]#

Extract tables from a PDF file.

Parameters:

  • path – Path to the PDF file

  • pages – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers. If None, extracts from all pages.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing table data

Return Format:

[
    {
        "page": 0,
        "index": 0,
        "rows": [
            ["Header1", "Header2", "Header3"],
            ["Data1", "Data2", "Data3"],
        ]
    },
    ...
]

Example:

tables = extractor.extract_tables(Path("paper.pdf"))
for table in tables:
    print(f"Table on page {table['page'] + 1}")
    for row in table['rows']:
        print(row)
get_page_count(path: Path) → int[source]#

Get the number of pages in a PDF file.

Parameters:

path – Path to the PDF file

Returns:

Number of pages

Example:

page_count = extractor.get_page_count(Path("paper.pdf"))
print(f"Document has {page_count} pages")

Backend Implementations#

PdfPlumberExtractor#

class papercut.extractors.pdfplumber.PdfPlumberExtractor[source]#

Bases: object

PDF extraction backend using pdfplumber library.

extract_text(path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract text from PDF.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers to extract. If None, extract all pages.

Return type:

str

Returns:

Extracted text as a string.

Raises:

  • InvalidPDFError – If the PDF cannot be opened.

  • ExtractionError – If text extraction fails.

extract_tables(path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract tables from PDF.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers to extract. If None, extract from all pages.

Returns:

  • page: 0-indexed page number

  • data: 2D list of cell values

  • bbox: Bounding box tuple (x0, y0, x1, y1)

Return type:

List of dictionaries containing

Raises:

  • InvalidPDFError – If the PDF cannot be opened.

  • ExtractionError – If table extraction fails.

get_page_count(path)[source]#

Get the number of pages in the PDF.

Parameters:

path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

int

Returns:

Number of pages.

Raises:

InvalidPDFError – If the PDF cannot be opened.

Default extraction backend using pdfplumber.

Features:

  • Accurate text extraction

  • Good table detection

  • Handles complex layouts

  • Proper exception handling (InvalidPDFError, ExtractionError)

Installation:

Included with base installation:

pip install papercut

Example:

from pathlib import Path
from papercut.extractors.pdfplumber import PdfPlumberExtractor

extractor = PdfPlumberExtractor()

# Extract text
text = extractor.extract_text(Path("paper.pdf"))

# Extract from specific pages
text = extractor.extract_text(Path("paper.pdf"), pages=[0, 1, 2])

# Extract tables
tables = extractor.extract_tables(Path("paper.pdf"))

# Get page count
num_pages = extractor.get_page_count(Path("paper.pdf"))

PyMuPDFExtractor#

Alternative fast backend using pymupdf.

Features:

  • Faster processing

  • Lower memory usage

  • Good for large documents

Installation:

pip install papercut[fast]

Configuration:

Set via environment variable:

export PAPERCUT_EXTRACTION__BACKEND=pymupdf

Implementing Custom Extractors#

You can implement custom extractors by conforming to the Extractor protocol:

from pathlib import Path
from typing import Optional

class CustomExtractor:
    """Custom PDF extraction implementation."""

    def extract_text(
        self,
        path: Path,
        pages: Optional[list[int]] = None
    ) -> str:
        # Your implementation here
        pass

    def extract_tables(
        self,
        path: Path,
        pages: Optional[list[int]] = None
    ) -> list[dict]:
        # Your implementation here
        pass

    def get_page_count(self, path: Path) -> int:
        # Your implementation here
        pass

Usage Example#

from pathlib import Path
from papercut.config import get_settings

# Get configured extractor
settings = get_settings()
backend = settings.extraction.backend

if backend == "pdfplumber":
    from papercut.extractors.pdfplumber import PdfPlumberExtractor
    extractor = PdfPlumberExtractor()
else:
    from papercut.extractors.pymupdf import PyMuPDFExtractor
    extractor = PyMuPDFExtractor()

# Extract content
pdf_path = Path("paper.pdf")

text = extractor.extract_text(pdf_path)
tables = extractor.extract_tables(pdf_path)
pages = extractor.get_page_count(pdf_path)

print(f"Extracted {len(text)} characters from {pages} pages")
print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables")
